metadata.title: CVE-2023-30456 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in arch/x86/kvm/vmx/nested.c in the Linux kernelbefore 6.2.8. nVMX on x86_64 lacks consistency checks for CR0 and CR4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-30456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-150-generic - 5.4.0-150.167
linux-image-5.4.0-150-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-150.167
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-150-generic - 5.4.0-150.167
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-150-lowlatency - 5.4.0-150.167
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-73-generic - 5.15.0-73.80~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-73-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-73.80~20.04.1
